title: Multiple Myeloma International Staging System (ISS)
desc: The Multiple Myeloma International Staging System (ISS) prognosticates the severity of multiple myeloma based on routinely obtained lab values.

orgreference.text: Durie BGM, Salmon SE. A clinical staging system for multiple myeloma. Cancer 1975; 36:842-854.
Greipp PR, et. al. International Staging System for Multiple Myeloma. JCO 2005; 23:3412-3420.

other_refer.text: International Myeloma Foundation. International Staging System. April 2002.

data.evidence: Staging based on serum β2 microglobulin and albumin levels.
data.facts:
Multiple Myeloma ISS interpretation:

Stage Criteria
I Serum β2 microglobulin <3.5 mg/L AND serum albumin ≥ 3.5 g/dL
II Either: serum β2 microglobulin <3.5 mg/L, but serum albumin <3.5 g/dL
OR
serum β2 microglobulin 3.5 – 5.4 mg/L irrespective of the serum albumin
III Serum β2 microglobulin ≥5.5 mg/L
